description.narrative: The Support to Security and Justice Sector Governance Project in Post- Conflict Iraq enables Security and justice sector institutions to provide a safe and secure environment for the people of Iraq.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1:
1.1 (a) i): Types of technical advisory support provided by UNDP to the Government of Iraq on Security Sector Reform Programme (SSRP) implementation; and, ii) Feedback/ recommendations on the technical advisory support provided from relevant stakeholders (Qualitative indicator). 1.1 b): # and type of M&E related trainings delivered to ONSA and SSR Support Committee to better implement SSRP. 1.2: The National Security Strategy (NSS) revised, endorsed, and implemented. 1.3: # of assessments conducted to appraise SSRP implementation including lessons learned by ONSA (disaggregated by type). 1.4: # of assessments conducted to assist Women in SSR Sub Working Group to develop an evidenced based action plan (disaggregated by type). 1.5: # of trainings delivered to MoI Planning Directorate to assist with MoI multi -year strategic plan (2019-2024) implementation (disaggregated by type).
Output 2:
2.1(a): Local Police Service Road Map developed and implemented. 2.1(b): # of Local Police Officers trained against prioritized training requirements in target locations (gender disaggregated). 2.1(c): # of small grants provided to civil society organizations to undertake local level initiatives to improve public-police collaboration. 2.2: # of prioritized/critical local police stations rehabilitated in target locations (as part of a “model police station” rebuilding initiative).
2.3(a): Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) on Criminal Investigations available for implementation. 2.3 (b): # of law enforcement and criminal justice sector officials trained on criminal investigations. (disaggregated by gender and area of sector expertise). 2.4 (a): # of specialised training workshops/ courses on suspect interviewing delivered. 2.4 (b): # of officers trained in suspected interviewing (disaggregated by gender). 2.4 (c): # of specialised training workshops/ courses on crime scene management delivered. 2.4 (d): # of officers trained (disaggreg

comment.narrative:
Output 1:
1.1 (a) i): GoI endorsed Security Sector Reform Programme is in place with working methods for implementation agreed (2018). SSRP implementation mechanisms consisting of the 7 systems of which 2 are fully Operational (2018). (1): Criminal Justice and Law Enforcement; and Critical Infrastructure Protection (CIP) system priorities are fully operational. (2): Defence and Internal Security Strategy, National Security Architecture, National Security Legislation; and Intelligence Community are partially operational and remain weak. (3): Due to prolonged formation of the new Government work on the Democratic oversight priority was stalled. However, SDC by-laws were endorsed by the Parliament in February 2018. 1.1 (b): One introductory/ basic training on M&E delivered to ONSA and SSR support committee by UNDP (2017). 1.2: National Security Strategy Document adopted (2017). 1.3: No SSRP appraisal studies undertaken (2020). 1.4: No initiatives undertaken to support Women in SSR sub working group (2020). 1.5: MoI multi- year strategic plan (2019-2020) is being implemented (2020). MoI Planning Directorate had identified strategic plan implementation and M&E as an existing gap amongst its core team responsible for leading strategy implementation(2020).
Output 2:
2.1(a): Road Map developed and endorsed by the MoI Minister (2018). 2.1 (b): 140 Local Police Officers trained and mentored on Improving effectiveness of Local Police basic and TOT trainings and Police Mid-Level Management Course (2018). 2.1 (c): 9 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/ police and other security and justice

Output 1:
1.1: SSRP implementation mechanism consisting of 7 systems of which 4 are fully operational.
1.2 (a): At least 10 follow up trainings including Training of Trainers (TOTs) delivered to Government Institutions, the Judiciary and the Parliamentary SDC.
1.2 (b): To be established within 6 months from the start date of this activity implementation
1.3: 12 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/ police and other security and justice service providers at local level.
Output 2:
2.1 (a): Implementation of Road map initiated with the at least 2 out of 6 Road Map Core Police functions fully operational. 2.1(b): 500 local police officers trained and mentored on Improving Effectiveness of Local Police (IELP) and Police Mid Level Management Course.
2.1 (c): 12 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/ police and other security and justice service providers at local level.
2.2: 8 in target locations.
2.3 (a): SOP endorsed. approved by MoI and implementation framework/ model is developed and operationalized.
2.3 (b): 100 officials trained.
2.4: A draft of the policy paper developed.
Output 3:
3.1(a): CSIP pilot initiative is designed and approved for implementation and CSIP pilot implemented in 5 priority pilot locations.
3.1(b): SOPs approved and applied.
3.1(c): 1000 (at-least 30% female)
3.1(d): To be established once project is initiated. 3.2. a) 3 3.3 1st year lessons learnt brief D&D.

National Security Strategy and its corresponding Security Sector Reform Programme implementation are in progress. A total of 8 SSR systems were operationalized of which some made steady progress than others. Systems with steady progress - Criminal Justice and Law Enforcement (emphasis is on improving local police and criminal investigations); Critical Infrastructure Protection; Boarder Strategy and, Defence and Internal Strategy. Slow progress was reported on National Security Architecture, National Security Legislation and Democratic/Institutional Oversight and Intelligence Community due to their highly political nature. Under Criminal Justice and Law Enforcement of which UNDP is the lead international partner coordinator - the implementation of the Local Police Service Road Map was initiated in coordination with the Police Affairs Agency and unified Standard Operating Procedures for Criminal Investigations was adopted as an internal Ministry of Interior regulation to be implemented in synchronicity with the former. (Both policy documents were elaborated and adopted by the government with advice and assistance from UNDP). In parallel and in pursuant to these efforts a total of 141 mid - ranking officers were trained in police management and a total of 37 local police trainers and criminal investigation specialists were up-skilled in advanced ToT courses on Improving Effectiveness of Local Policing (IELP) and Criminal Investigations. Total of 12 quick impact projects were also implemented by 09 CSOs to advance public - police collaborations in liberated and other areas and included an outreach of 1699 community members, police and local authorities .

Output 1:
1.1(a) i):SSRP implementation mechanism consisting of 8 systems of which all 7 are fully operational. 1.1 (b): One training on M&E of SSRP delivered to ONSA and SSR Support Committee. SSRP M&E plan developed and implemented by ONSA and SSR Support Committee. 1.2: Revised NSS is finalised by the NSS review committee, Revised NSS endorsed by NSC (and the Cabinet where applicable) 1.3:The SSRP Assessment methodology and design developed and agreed by ONSA and SSR Support Committee. One SSRP assessment conducted. 1.4:Develop joint study methodology between the SWG and UNDP on Women and in SSR.One assessment on Women in SSR conducted. 1.5:One comprehensive course on strategy implementation and M&E delivered to MoI Planning Directorate officials composed of the strategy implementation core team. A strategy implementation plan is developed by the core team.
Output 2:
2.1(a): The Road Map is continued to be operational with all 6 core Police Functions of the Road Map fully operational. 2.1 (b): 600 local police officers trained and mentored on Improving Effectiveness of Local Police and Police Mid-Level Management Courses (gender disaggregated). 2.1 (c): 20 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/ police and other security and justice service providers at local level. 2.2: 2 in target locations. 2.3 (a): SOPs continue to be operational at provincial level. 2.3 (b): 600 officials trained (gender disaggregated). 2.4 (a): Two specialised trainings on suspected interviewing delivered. 2.4(b): 50 officers trained (gender disaggregated). 2.4 (c): Two specialised trainings on crime scene management delivered. 2.4 (d): 50 officers trained (gender disaggregated). 2.5 (a): One Comprehensive assessment conducted. 2.5 (b): TBD: following the completion of the assessment report and key findings. 2.5 (c): 50 judges trained. 2.5(d): 50% of knowledge increase.
Output 3:
3.1(a): CSIP pilot implementation concluded in 1 target location (i.e. Qurna - Basra). CSIP pilot initiative is rolled out to 1 additional target location (TBC). 3.1(b): SoP is fully operational in the additional/ new pilot location (TBC). 3.1(c): 500 (at-least 30% female). 3.1(d): Improved community engagement through the community development initiative in 1 additional/ new pilot location where CSIP is in place. 3.2: 4. 3.3:2nd year and project end lessons learned brief developed and finalized (additional/ new target location).

Output 1:
1.1(a) i): Technical advisory support provided to the Government of Iraq on SSRP implementation, with focus on the implementation of the SSR 7 systems and the women in SSR cross-cutting system; (ii): Yes 1.1 (b): Not achieved: UNDP re-introduce in the discussion through the recently drafted Iraq SSR Roadmap, PMO indicate the responsibility of the SSRP review/assessment to be done under the Joint Planning Committee. The process plan and support to be elaborated in Q1 2022. 1.2: One workshop and a series of virtual sessions delivered to NSS Standing Committee and provided technical advice, including and assistance in the drafting exercise, including reviewing the initial draft of the new NSS and meeting with ONSA to identify specific areas of IP support for the next steps of the drafting process. Also, supported the inception of the Gender Study with NMI in Iraq.
1.3: Not achieved: UNDP re-introduced discussion through the recently drafted Iraq SSR Roadmap, PMO indicate the responsibility of the SSRP review/assessment to be done under the Joint Planning Committee. The process plan and support to be elaborated in Q1 2022. 1.4: Initiated the inception phase of MoI Gender Study on Iraq’s Security Sector (i.e.,desk research). Study / data collection is expected to start in Q1, 2022 1.5: In support of the implementation of MoIs 5-year strategic plan (2019 -2023): (i) Delivered 9-day training to 17 senior officers and specialists from MoI on strategic planning, strategic analysis related to risks and threats, and scenario planning and policy development; (ii) Delivered 8-day training to 20 senior officers and specialists from MoI on Advance Risk Management and Assessment.
Output 2:
2.1(a): The Local Police Service Road Map and its 5 core functions and 6 supporting functions are being implemented in accordance with the MoI five-year strategic plan (2019-2023) 2.1 (b): Trained 700 (23 women) police officers in Improving Effectiveness in Local Policing (IELP), Criminal Investigations, and Mid-Level Police Management 2.1 (c): 13 LVGs worth USD 127,958 to awarded to 11 local CSOs to implement QIPs in Baghdad, Karbala, Basra, Anbar, Salah-al-Din, and Ninawa to improve local safety and community-police partnerships 2.2: Model Police Station Pilot assessment designed and completed in collaboration with MoI. 6 Police Stations in Anbar (2) Ninewa (2), Baghdad (1), and Basra (1) recommended for the pilot initiative and implementation plan developed and approved by MoI. Pilot initiatives are expected to start in Q1 2022 . 2.3 (a): SOP on criminal investigation developed and being implemented through the Local Police Service Road Map (core functions, crime management, and security and protection management) within the MoI five-year strategic plan (2019 - 2023) 2.3 (b): 121 (13 women) Local Police Officers trained in criminal investigations through virtual and E-learning platform and in-person training modalities 2.4 (a): 2 specialized trainings on suspect interviewing (crime scene management / homicide investigations) delivered to police officers 2.4(b): 45 (0 women) police officers trained in suspected interviewing (crime scene management / homicide investigations) 2.4 (c): 2 specialized trainings on suspect interviewing (crime scene management / homicide investigations) delivered to police officers 2.4 (d): 47 (all men) police officers trained in crime scene management / homicide investigations 2.5 (a): Conducted an assessment of existing capacities and procedures in the justice sector to investigate and adjudicate complex and financial crimes and drafted a report with key findings and recommendations, entitled ‘Strengthening Justice Sector Capacities to Uphold the Rule of Law in Iraq’ (February 2021). The report is expected has been finalized in consultation with the SJC 2.5 (b): Finalized and launched Policy paper, ’’ Financial Investigations: An Integrated Approach ‘Follow the Money’’ 2.5 (c): 27(3 women) judges trained in prosecuting organized and financial crime cases 2.5(d): 98%
Output 3:
3.1(a): Designed and completed the implementation of CSIP– 1 and CSIP– 2 in Qurna, Basra and Qairawan, Sinjar, respectively . 3.1(b): SOP developed and being implemented to guide the CSIP pilot implementations in Basra in (CSIP– 1) and Sinjar (CSIP– 2) 3.1(c): 103 (28 women) FVFs from the PMF received mental and psychosocial support and training in business skills, electrical work, carpentry, masonry, tailoring, and food processing (cooking) for women in Qairawan, Sinjar. A business startup grant of $ 3,400 was distributed to them as part of CSIP initiative, aimed at helping them reintegrate into society and the workforce. 3.1(d): 2 primary school selected to benefit from the CSIP community security investment schemes in Tel Qasab Complex in Qairawan, Sinjar Governorates: Al-Fagr Aljadeed and Al-dhuha primary schools for boys and girls has been renovated
3.2: CSIP-2: Completed four surveys (Course Feedback Baseline Course Feedback Baseline End line and Instructor survey, Family leadership and Tribal leadership survey with 100% surveys response rate. The survey confirmed that instructors were satisfied with FVFs as they were from different backgrounds and ages with some having limited literacy levels 3.3: CSIP-2: Produced a stand-alone lessons learned Presentation in which includes a review of data collected under CSIP .

Output 1:
1.1 (i) SSRP implementation mechanism consisting of 8 systems of which 6 are fully operational; (ii) Yes
1.2a: At least 15 follow up trainings including TOTs delivered to Government Institutions, the Judiciary and the Parliamentary SDC. 1.2b: Relevant GoI authorities have acquired necessary capacity to implement and monitor SSRP - Target set on a scale of 1 to 5 with 1 being limited capacity and, 5 being fully capacitated).
Output 2:
2.1a: The Road Map is operational with at least 4 out of the 6 Road Map Core Functions fully operational. 2.1b: 450 local police officers trained and mentored on Improving Effectiveness of Local Police (IELP) and Police Mid-Level Management Course. 2.1c: 15 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/ police and other security and justice service providers at local level. 2.2: 1 in target locations. 2.3a: SOPs fully operational. 2.3b: 450 officials trained.
Output 3:
3.1a: CSIP pilot initiative is designed and approved for implementation in one target location. (i.e. Qurna - Basra). 3.1b: SOPs fully operational in 1 target location (i.e. Qurna, Basra) It is reviewed and updated to further fit in to 1 additional/ new pilot location (TBC). 3.1c: 500 (at-least 30% female) 3.1d: Improved community engagement through the community development initiative to rehabilitated Qurna vocational training centre and, 1 additional / new pilot location where CSIP is in place. 3.2: 4 3.3: 1st year and project end lessons learned brief developed and finalized (target location Qurna, Basra). Drafting of 2nd year lesson learned brief initiated (additional/ new target location– (TBC).

Output 1:
1.1: (i). 7 systems and cross-cutting system on women in SSR are being implemented with work in progress on identified strategies/policies and recommendations; (ii). Yes. 1.2 (a): 8. 1.2 (b): Yes- 4 (on a scale of 1 -5, with one being limited capacity to 5 being fully capacitated).
Output 2:
2.1 (a): Local Police Service Road Map developed, and its core 6 functions implemented within MoI 2020 AWP corresponding to its organisational 5-year strategic plan (2019-2023). 2.1(b): 68 (F: 6 M: 62), specifically IELP 40 (F3; M:37) and Mid-Level Management 28 (F:3, M:25). 2.1(c): 12 grants provided for civil society to implement quick impact projects to develop and strengthen collaborative partnerships between public/ police and other security and justice service providers at local level. The Programme could not award the total 15 grants due to limited number of CSOs that qualified all of the UNDP standard criteria to award the grants. 2.2: Model Police Station Pilot field assessments involving 29 police stations in Anbar 6, Ninewa 15, Basra 4, and Baghdad 4, concluded and selection of police stations for the pilot will follow. 2.3 (a): Yes, SOPs on Criminal Investigations implemented within MoI 2020 AWP corresponding to its organisational 5-year strategic plan (2019-2023). 2.3 (b): 80 (F:8, M: 72). Specifically, Training of Trainers Course on Standard Operations Procedures for Criminal Investigations: 25 (F:0, M:25) and Basic Training Course of Criminal Investigations: 55 (F:8, M47).
Output 3

(i.e.1.CSIP beneficiary survey, 2. family beneficiary survey ,3. QIPs vocational training instructor and 4. community leadership survey); (ii) Yes- New / one additional pilot location identified - Qairwan in Sinjar, Ninewa. 3.2: 4 perception surveys are completed.
